title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: armed police arrest two more over sheffield shooting .
man critically ill after attack in harehills , leeds .
one of two women stabbed at a flat in huddersfield dies .
pm pays tribute to veteran leeds-born politician sir gerald kaufman .
sheffield man sentenced to 24 years in prison following shooting .
family renew appeal 10 years after knaresborough man 's hit-and-run death .
david wagner and garry monk banned by fa after touchline altercation .

documents.title: scots artist teaching sir patrick stewart
text: scots artist teaching sir patrick stewart
author: Pauline McLean
BBC Scotland arts correspondent

documents.title: jo cox 's sister speaks of 'new reality '
text: jo cox 's sister speaks of 'new reality '

documents.title: judge convicts 'cash for crash ' killers
text: judge convicts 'cash for crash ' killers

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: that 's all from us for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue here through the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :

documents.title: breakingwagner and monk banned by fa
text: breakingwagner and monk banned by fa

documents.title: latest yorkshire weather forecast
text: tonight will see scattered heavy showers slowly dying out , with clear periods developing .
the minimum temperature .
will be about -1c ( 30f ) with ice on untreated surfaces .
there 'll also be a freshening westerly wind .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : meet the girl helping teddies find a new family
text: an 11-year-old girl from harrogate is raising money for charity by encouraging people to donate teddy bears and other cuddly toys with the promise she 'll find them a new home .
scarlet smith-dunn has set up a website where people can choose to pay to `` adopt '' a teddy .
she washes , brushes and prepares each teddy for adoption before they are sent out to their new `` parents '' .
the website only launched a week ago , but already she 's had people buying the teddies for £ 30 a piece .
scarlet and mum victoria explain what brought about the idea :
author: Jules Bellerby
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: new leeds united film headlines international festival
text: a specially commissioned film about leeds united will be among the headline attractions at the first leeds international festival which comes to the city in april .
the brand new project , made by moving image , is set to be premiered at an as-yet-unconfirmed city centre location and features narration from club legends gordon strachan ( and vinnie jones .
the film will be part of a wider cultural festival , which will be held from 22 to 30 april .
it incorporates the already established live at leeds music festival , with brit award winner rag 'n ' bone man among the acts who will perform at various venues around the city .
broadcaster lauren laverne will also lead an empowering woman with tech conference , with other female business leaders also set to feature .

documents.title: tommy ward investigation to feature on crimewatch
text: cctv footage linked to the death of a pensioner killed following a violent robbery in south yorkshire will be shown on the bbc 's crimewatch later .
ex-miner tommy ward , 80 , was found badly beaten at his house in salisbury road , maltby , south yorkshire on 1 october 2015 .
he died from his injuries in hospital on 23 february , 2016 .
about £ 30,000 of his life savings was thought to have been stolen from his home in the attack .
the video shows a car driving along salisbury road , then making a u-turn before continuing back on the same road .
crimewatch is on bbc 1 at 21:00 tonight .

documents.title: knife-wielding man attacks and robs woman in huddersfield
text: a knife-wielding man grabbed and threatened a woman in huddersfield before stealing her mobile phone last week , police have revealed .
the incident happened on union street at about 21:45 on wednesday 22 february as the 21-year-old woman was walking along the path .
she was approached from behind by the man who then grabbed her by the arm and threatened her with a knife before they both fell to the floor .
during the struggle he took the victim 's mobile phone and then ran off .
the suspect is described as tall and wearing dark clothing , with his face covered .

documents.title: it 's beginning to feel a lot like winter
text: while we may have featured some very spring-like here and here from across yorkshire earlier today , it seems like winter still has a little while to go before it loosens its icy grip in york :
gritting to start at 9pm this evening with forecast of wintery and persistent showers , road surface temps will fall below zero at midnight

documents.title: countdown for wakefield city centre improvement fund
text: it 's the last day for businesses in wakefield to vote on plans to set up a fund to improve the city centre .
they 've been voting on whether they want to establish .
a business improvement district .
- something .
already operating in places including leeds and keighley .
businesses would pay subscriptions and the money would then be used on big projects to promote the city .

documents.title: from manor top to top of the world : sheffield man ready for everest challenge
text: a sheffield man with terminal cancer has raised enough money to climb mount everest .
ian toothill is trying to fundraise for macmillan cancer research and is now ready to head off in less than a month .
he says he 'll definitely face some challenges on the climb : `` i eat a very specific diet to offset the effects of cancer and i wo n't really be able to eat that diet .
`` also there 'll obviously be problems with acclimatisation and even though i was born in manor top that does n't quite count as acclimatisation ! ''

documents.title: bradford striker jones not short of self-belief
text: bradford city striker alex jones believes he will go on to score more goals for the club after opening his account for the club at the weekend .
jones scored the winner against his former club port vale in saturday and the 22-year-old is n't short of self-belief .
he says : `` i was n't lacking any confidence .
it 's just another goal for myself and another goal for the team .
if i can keep chalking-off goals as the season goes on , it 's only going to help the team do well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : lightcliffe cricketer describes horror injury
text: west yorkshire cricketer alex tait suffered horrendous injuries after a freak accident two weeks ago during a training session .
he was bowling in the nets at lightcliffe cricket club when he was hit in the face by a cricket ball .
a fortnight on and he 's had surgery on his 15 broken bones and has now spoken about the injury and his road to recovery :
warning : this video contains images viewers may find upsetting .

documents.title: claudia lawrence : 43rd birthday of missing york chef
text: as we mentioned earlier , today is the 43rd birthday of york chef claudia lawrence who 's been missing for almost eight years .
this is what we now know about the case :

documents.title: watch : protesters campaign against job centre closures in sheffield
text: about a dozen protesters braved the bad weather this afternoon to campaign against the closure a sheffield job centre .
the job centre on eastern avenue is one of 78 across the uk earmarked for closure under department for work and pension ( dwp ) proposals .
the plans have faced opposition , as some people could now face a 25-minute bus journey into town to sign on .
tom bishell , branch secretary for the pcs union at dwp sheffield , stressed : `` it must be kept open for the claimants who use the site , the members of staff who work there and the local area . ''
a consultation period regarding the plans closes at 17:00 tomorrow , .
with protestors expected to return for a similar demo at lunchtime :
author: Oli Constable
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sir gerald kaufman 'will be very much missed ' - pm
text: the prime minister has paid tribute to veteran leeds-born politician sir gerald kaufman , who 's died at the age of 86 .
sir gerald was labour mp for manchester gorton and father of the house of commons .
he was a junior minister between 1974 and 1979 , and held a number of senior shadow cabinet posts through the 1980s , before returning to the backbenches in the early 1990s .
speaking in the commons , theresa may said she was `` very sad '' to hear of his death .
`` his was a life of remarkable commitment to his constituents in manchester and to the political life of the nation .
he spent more than half his life as a parliamentarian .
`` as father of the house his wisdom and experience will be very much missed by mps on all sides of the house . ''

documents.title: newcastle falcons to sign yorkshire carnegie back-rower burrows
text: newcastle falcons will sign back-rower ryan burrows from championship side yorkshire carnegie at the end of the current season on undisclosed terms .
the 28-year-old , who joined carnegie from rotherham in 2011 , has scored 28 tries in 138 games at headingley .
he is the fifth confirmed signing by falcons for 2017-18 , following the .
matavesi brothers , .
maxime mermoz and dth van der merwe .
`` dean richards really sold the vision and the ambition , '' burrows said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'hopefully he 'll be back ' - huddersfield town boss wagner on nahki wells return
text: huddersfield town will check the fitness of striker nahki wells ahead of wednesday night 's fa cup fifth round replay against manchester city .
wells missed saturday 's draw at barnsley because of an ankle problem .
but terriers head coach david wagner does n't seem overly worried about a long-term absence for the player .
he 's told bbc radio leeds sport : `` he got a twist to his ankle in training and it was too big a risk to bring him in to our squad - but hopefully he 'll be back . ''
author: Dave Fletcher
BBC Radio Leeds Sport

documents.title: armed police arrest two more over sheffield shooting
text: two more people have been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of assel al-essaie after armed police stopped a vehicle on the sheffield parkway .
the 23-year-old ( died in hospital after being shot in the chest in daniel hill , walkley on saturday 18 february .
south yorkshire police has not released any further details of those arrested today .
it takes the total number of arrests in connection to the attack to seven - five others have since been released on bail .

documents.title: watch : two , four , six , eight , who do we appreciate ? harrogate hornets !
text: an award-winning group of harrogate cheerleaders is looking for new members .
the harrogate hornets perform a mix of dance , gymnastics and fancy stunts - some of which are brilliantly demonstrated in this short clip .

pay attention at about 10 seconds from the end and you 'll see a very reluctant jericho keys , bbc radio york 's breakfast show reporter , attempting to retain his cool while getting involved and attempting a cart wheel :
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: man critically ill after harehills attack
text: detectives in leeds are hunting a group of men who punched and stamped on a 49-year-old man before using a 4x4 vehicle to run into him .
the incident happened on foundry approach in harehills early on saturday morning , and left the man critically ill in hospital .
police say the man had been a customer at the misha food and wine store ( when he became involved in an altercation with three men who were in an argument with two other men .
the men then left the shop and got into the 4x4 vehicle which hit the man before leaving the scene .
a vehicle believed to be the one involved was later found burned out .
a 24-year-old man 's been arrested and released on bail .

documents.title: listen : sheffield researchers ' premature births breakthrough
text: researchers in sheffield are getting closer to perfecting a new test which could predict if pregnant women are at risk of giving birth early .
that means doctors would be able to treat them to delay the onset of labour , giving their babies a better chance .
and it could also save the nhs millions of pounds .
professor dilly anumba , from the university of sheffield , says the new test will help determine the level of risk involved in a pregnancy :
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: yorkshire 's weather this afternoon
text: here 's how the weather for the rest of the day is looking across yorkshire .
occasional heavy showers of rain , with sleet and snow across hills , and a risk of hail and thunder .
it 'll feel cold in brisk winds .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: yorkshire in countdown to spring
text: earlier a beautiful pic of a bee in a daffodil in leeds prompted me to ask for more of your early signs of spring .
yorkshire 's bbc weather watchers have been quick to respond .
aberford 's early daffodils were sent in by gerrywatch , york minster 's display of crocuses came courtesy of june gothika and the snowdrops were spotted by ingersley at newton on ouse .
we 're definitely on the look out for more signs that , despite the wind and rain , the earth is pushing up its floral beauty ready for milder times ahead .
to send your in simply click here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sam riley : the yorkshire actor taking centre stage in new bbc war-time drama ss-gb
text: as the new face of bbc prime-time sunday nights , yorkshire actor sam riley , is enjoying the jump from big screen to our living rooms .
the alternative history ss-gb , adapted from the len deighton novel of the same name , offers a glimpse of what life could have been like had .
the germans actually won world war two .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: family of hit-and-run victim appeal
text: family of hit-and-run victim appeal

documents.title: leeds man suffers serious injuries in 'wheelie ' hit and run
text: a 35-year-old man suffered multiple facial fractures and a brain injury when he was hit by a motorcylist who was performing a wheelie on the wrong side of the road .
the incident occurred on hollyshaw lane , in halton , in the early hours of yesterday morning .
two riders , on off-road motorbikes , left the scene without stopping .

the victim is being treated at leeds general infirmary and police want to speak to anyone who saw two off-road motorbikes being ridden around the halton area of leeds on saturday night into sunday morning .
this was a very serious incident which has left a man with significant injuries and we are currently carrying out a range of enquiries to trace the riders of the two off-road motorbikes involved . ''

documents.title: listen : the 'vandalism ' now worth hundreds of thousands of pounds
text: gone are the days when street art was labelled graffiti or , worse still , vandalism .
in fact some pieces of art which started life on a street corner are now worth sizeable amounts of money .
dee warburton grew up in sheffield and wants to curate an exhibition in london , featuring work which has been produced in his home city , as well as from around the world .
however , he needs to raise £ 50,000 in order to stage the event at the westbank gallery in notting hill .
he tells me there 's still a stigma around the genre , but plenty of big spenders are starting to realise the appeal :
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: appeal following theft at york petrol station
text: police in north yorkshire are appealing for help to identify the man and woman in these cctv images .
officers say they want to speak to them in connection with a theft at the bp petrol station on lawrence street in york .
it happened at about 01:50 on 20 january when three bottles of wine were stolen from the shop at the garage .

documents.title: yorkshire in can you 'bee'-live it ?
text: have you noticed the occasional signs of spring appearing around yorkshire ?
i 've been delighted to have spotted snowdrops and crocuses appearing around tree bases .
but the prize for earliest sign of spring spotted so far must surely go to david hudson .
he scooped a spring double in bramhope , leeds , and snapped it quickly - a bee on a daffodil .
we 'd love to see more signs of spring , simply click here to send yours in .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: do n't try this on your morning commute !
text: if you 've ever been late for a train in sheffield , you 'll probably have had the experience of dashing down howard street .
well , from friday 17 to sunday 19 march , you 'll need to find an alternative route
the area is being transformed into a downhill mountain bike slalom course , which will see pairs of riders race from top to bottom as part .
the outdoor city weekender .
the howard street dual is one of a number of events which will take place across the city , which also include a film festival and an international climbing event .
it 's being described as `` knockout-style '' - though we hope that 's not a literal description .

documents.title: west yorkshire playhouse festival to focus on dementia
text: almost £ 100,000 of arts council cash has been given to the west yorkshire playhouse in leeds to help it develop a new festival focusing on dementia .
the management team at the theatre say they want to `` explore the experiences of people living with dementia '' by using people who live with the condition as writers and performers .
in 2014 , the playhouse was praised for staging what was billed as the world 's first dementia-friendly performance .

west yorkshire playhouse 's community development manager nicky taylor says : `` we anticipate that the festival will bring opportunities for discussion and debate about dementia , to challenge stereotypes , and to provide a creative and fun opportunity for people with dementia to explore making and enjoying theatre . ''

documents.title: listen : family of knaresborough hit-and-run victim make renewed appeal
text: the family of a 75-year-old man who was killed by a hit-and-run driver in north yorkshire 10 years ago have made a fresh appeal for information .
bill hendry was crossing stockwell road in knaresborough with his dog abby , when he was struck on 26 february 2007 .
the driver left the scene and mr hendry was taken to harrogate hospital but died the same day .
his family laid flowers at the scene and made a fresh appeal for information on the anniversary of his death .

christine torr , mr hendry 's stepdaughter , is again appealing for anyone with information to come forward and says the whole family still experiences a `` sense of loss '' and has no `` closure '' :
author: Nathan Turvey
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: fiddle while you work - york 's fiddle-playing tightrope walker
text: this sounds like the start of a joke - what do you get if you cross a fiddle player with a tightrope walker ?
the answer is gasps of amazement and a treat for the ears .
this was the scene in york yesterday .
a fiddle playing tightrope walker - how is he balancing without putting his arms out ?
sticking one leg out is just showing off .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield man sentenced to 24 years in prison following shooting
text: a 24-year-old man from sheffield has been jailed for 24 years for the shooting of a 63-year-old man during a robbery last year .

jonathan mcgregor , of kyle close , southey green , was sentenced at leeds crown court on friday 24 february after being found guilty of grievous bodily harm , attempted robbery and possession of a firearm .
the victim suffered a gunshot wound to his stomach when three men broke into his home and threatened him in june last year .

documents.title: woman dies after stabbing in huddersfield
text: a 42-year-old woman has died as a result of injuries sustained in an incident in huddersfield on thursday .
the woman was found by police officers at a property on greenlea court in the early hours of the morning , along with a 25-year-old woman .
both had suffered serious stab wounds .

mark minott , 41 , of greenlea court , huddersfield appeared att bradford magistrates court on saturday morning , charged with one count of attempted murder and one count of causing grievous bodily harm .
he was remanded into custody .

documents.title: watch : 'the bear necessities of life ' will come to harrogate
text: an 11-year-old girl from harrogate has started an adoption agency for unwanted soft toys to raise money for vulnerable children .
scarlet has set up a website where people can choose to pay to `` adopt '' a teddy :
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: breakingyork city to play lincoln in fa trophy
text: york city have been drawn against lincoln city in the semi-finals of the fa trophy .
the first leg will be at bootham crescent on tuesday 14 march , with the return on saturday 18 march .
the winners go to wembley to face the winners of the tie between either macclesfield town and dulwich hamlet , who replay their quarter-final tomorrow , or tranmere rovers
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: update on yorkshire roads hotspots
text: here 's a quick update on the travel hot-spots around the county at the moment :
to report traffic and travel incidents dial .
0330 123 0184. at any time .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: listen : york city knights through in challenge cup
text: york city knights avoided making the headlines for all the wrong reasons by beating the amateurs of egremont rangers in the challenge cup third round yesterday .
they could now face a championship side in the next round when the draw is made tomorrow night .
coach james ford was happy with his team 's performance in the 48-8 win :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : call for gps to do more for people with eating disorders
text: when you go to see your gp , you expect to be given the right help and support and for people suffering with conditions like anorexia or bulimia that help should see you referred to a mental health service straight away .
but i 've been finding out today that nearly a third of those with eating disorders never get that referral .

eating disorder charity beat - who revealed the findings in new research - are now calling for increased training for gps so they can properly diagnose psychological and behavioural symptoms quicker .
jessica mell is studying nutrition and public health at sheffield hallam university - she had an eating disorder as a teenager :
author: Toby Foster
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: another difficult day for parents of claudia lawrence
text: today would be the 43rd birthday of missing york woman claudia lawrence .
she 's not been seen now for almost eight years .
police have recently scaled down their murder investigation into her disappearance .
author: Nathan Turvey
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: witnesses sought after sex assault claim in sheffield
text: south yorkshire police are appealing for witnesses after a 25-year-old woman was the victim of an alleged sexual assault in sheffield .
the attack was reported to have taken place at 22:45 on thursday 9 february as the victim walked onto spital hill road , after leaving the tesco supermarket on saville street .
the woman was able to run away and was uninjured .

police are looking for a man described as being about 25-years-old , of a slim build , around 6ft tall , with short dark hair and is believed to have a dark mark , possibly a mole , on the right side of his face .
anyone with information about the incident is asked to call 101 , quoting incident number 1271 .

documents.title: traffic and travel : bus service delays in leeds
text: problems on the buses in leeds :
leeds service update - traffic congestion causing service delays by up to 40 minutes presently .
author: Sarah Wakefield
BBC Radio Leeds News

documents.title: listen : 'is anyone listening ? ' - care group calls for government action on care home 'crisis '
text: lets return to a story that we first brought you last month .

since martin lister from scarborough , who has parkinson 's , left hospital , his 75-year-old wife margaret has been forced to take a three hour round trip by bus to see her husband in a care home in bridlington because there is n't anywhere closer to home .
the county council says this is an extreme case .

this morning on bbc radio york , mike padgham , who 's based in scarborough and is chair of the independent care group which represents care home owners , has called on the government to do more to try and sort out what he calls the care home `` crisis '' :
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC Radio York

documents.title: hours left for mep to pay damages to south yorkshire mps
text: a high court deadline for ukip mep jane collins to pay hundreds of thousands of pounds in damages and costs to three south yorkshire labour mps expires later today .

a court ruled that in a speech to her party conference in 2014 she falsely accused sarah champion , john healey and sir kevin baron , whose constituencies cover rotherham , of covering up knowledge of grooming and the sexual assault of hundreds of young girls in the town .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: police aim to identify yorkshire soldier killed in wwi
text: detectives have been working to identify the body of world war one soldier from the yorkshire regiment , whose body was discovered in a field in france .
the soldier was found with a distinctive badge , which meant mod investigators could start to work out his identity .
one hundred years on from his death , they say they have been able to narrow down the search for his family .
author: Sarah Wakefield
BBC Radio Leeds News

documents.title: watch : we could n't sweep this one under the carpet
text: every five-year-old is obsessed with something .
and what 's that something for jake hempshall ?
road sweepers .
his mum leanne got in touch with doncaster council to arrange for jake to visit the north bridge depot for his 5th birthday .
but when they got there , he got way more than he expected :

documents.title: who says romance is dead ?
text: it 's original , i 'll give him that
man proposes to his girlfriend - in yorkshire teabags !
author: David Ward
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: listen : dales farmer concerned for future of industry
text: a yorkshire dales hill farmer says producers will go out of business if eu food subsidies disappear .
the government has yet to decide on a post-brexit agricultural policy .
garry schofield is a sheep farmer who also has a few beef cattle to raise some extra money .
he says cutting subsidies will impact on the environment and could also lead to overproduction of food :
author: Nathan Turvey
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: traffic and travel : no delays to trains across yorkshire
text: some good news for you if you 're about to leave the house and make your way down to the station to catch a train .
there are currently no delays reported on the departure boards at leeds , sheffield or york .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: listen : south yorkshire hospitals spend over £ 50m on agency staff
text: hospital trusts in south yorkshire have more than doubled the amount spent on agency staff in the last five years .
it means the bill for temporary employees topped £ 53m during that period .
our political reporter charlotte rose has the details .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : weather - a mixed bag across yorkshire
text: sunny spells and showers today :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : ten years on from knaresborough hit and run , family appeal for information
text: a fresh appeal will be made today about the hit-and-run killing of a north yorkshire pensioner on the tenth anniversary of his death .
bill hendry , who was 75 , was killed in knaresborough in february 2007 .
lee stott reports :
author: David Ward
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: the sports headlines from across yorkshire this morning
text: here are the top stories after a busy weekend of sport :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : cricketer reveals horrific injuries
text: a west yorkshire cricketer is recovering from major surgery following a freak sporting accident .
alex tait was left with 15 broken bones , including a fractured skull , after he was hit in the face by a cricket ball .
he was bowling in the nets at lightcliffe cricket club which is part of the bradford premier league :
author: Sarah Wakefield
BBC Radio Leeds News

documents.title: police search for missing leeds boy
text: have you seen antonis iaonnou ?
if so , police would like to hear from you .
they 've put out this of him .
# missing from leeds antonis ioannou - originally from london .
if seen please ring 101 quoting log 1428 of the 26/2/17
author: Sarah Wakefield
BBC Radio Leeds News

documents.title: the headlines from across yorkshire this morning
text: here are some of the stories which are making the news :
author: David Ward
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: it 's another chilly morning out there , so make sure you wrap up warm before you leave the house today .
you can also expect the roads to be that little bit busier today with all schools across yorkshire back after the half-term break .
whatever happens we 're here throughout the day keeping you up to date with the latest .
news , .
sport , .
travel and .
weather .
author: David Ward
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
